channel.title: Need to make this straight
channel.description: [center][size=14pt][b]THERE IS PRACTICALLY NO DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE XBOX ONE AND PLAYSTATION 4.[/b][/size] [b]In the event of a fan boy joining conversation I strongly encourage you all to ignore it.[/b] [img]http://gyazo.com/aa9d9efae2626d261ce54dfbde48419f.png[/img] p.s. there is no used game fee for xbox one now

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I too have both the xbox and the ps3 and I can attest to the ps3 being more reliable and stabler with way less random crashes or freezing than the xbox

Possibly simply something wrong with the way I had it setup, however the xbox was pretty much always louder and overheating and it actually crashed once and I had to send it in for repairs and I have never had to do that with the ps3 [bought 2 months after release]

Read full topic

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:16, topic:529298”]I really just cannot wait to play Watchdogs with that 8 core and 8gb of RAM. As for everyone talking about the quality of Microsofts products, I have no fudgeing clue what you are all talking about, I’ve had the same Xbox 360 for years now and so has my brother, we have had no problems at all.[/quote]I’ve never been a person to move my xbox, and it is in a spot where it won’t get over heated. It’s really hit or miss, if you fanboy the xbox that much to think they never broke then you need a reality check. The only major problems I heard about the Ps3 were the eject button sometimes went faulty and the newer slim models had a hardware problem. There were countless problems with the original xbox, the new one however is quite nice. (P.s I have both the PS3 and xbox 360.)

Read full topic

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

It’s pretty surprising that people compare two console’s powers when it’s the exclusives/other features/customer loyalty that draw people to them

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I really just cannot wait to play Watchdogs with that 8 core and 8gb of RAM. As for everyone talking about the quality of Microsofts products, I have no fudgeing clue what you are all talking about, I’ve had the same Xbox 360 for years now and so has my brother, we have had no problems at all. Speaking of quality on products, have you even held the Playstations controller? You can play the flute with the space inside that thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:529298”]It was a marketing scheme

They got everyone mad at something and then completely removed it, and now there is virtually no reason to not consider buying an xbox 1[/quote]

Their terms and conditions are ‘subject to change’ whenever they want, so they can add that right back the day it comes out if they wanted to.

Read full topic

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:529298”]It was a marketing scheme

They got everyone mad at something and then completely removed it, and now there is virtually no reason to not consider buying an xbox 1[/quote]

It wasn’t a good one. The price was my reason, all the other shit that they removed was just an added bonus as to why not to buy it.

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Mikeyzzz, post:11, topic:529298”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=648054.msg4359128#msg4359128 date=1378333429]

IGN

Xbox Live on Xbox One - Xbox One Wiki Guide - IGN

Xbox Live on Xbox One - Xbox One: Xbox Live on Xbox One has been confirmed by Microsoft. Your Xbox Live Gold account and Achievements will carry over to Xbox One. Your Gamertag and A...

The Xbox Live on Xbox One subscription price will continue to cost $59.99 per year

A PlayStation Plus subscription costs $49.99 for a full year

I’d still rather side with the PS4 simply because I hate Microsoft and love Sony. Microsoft is just a very shitty company.
Regardless of my opinion, I won’t be getting either; PC >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> [size=4pt]Consoles[/size]
[/quote]Microsoft are the people we thank today for the computers, I think.[/quote]
Doesn’t mean I should or do value them as a company whatsoever. I admire Bill Gates but I think Microsoft is worthless trash in every aspect

Read full topic

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:7, topic:529298”]Honestly, they probably used that marketing. As stupid as it may seem, think of how many more people heard about the Xbox: One and their horrible idea. Just a thought.

I’m pretty sure PSN will still be free and Xbox live will still cost up to 9.99/mo. Sony is a much better company that cares for their consumers, I’ve gone through 3 of the ‘Original’ xbox 360s, and I had to pay to get 2 of them fixed, problems that weren’t even my fault. Microsoft produces cheap products to last a few years so they break and make people purchase the newer product.

Regardless, both systems will flourish.[/quote]PS4 requires a paid PSPlus account.

VentureBeat – 11 Jun 13

But there’s a catch: Sony is charging for multiplayer on PlayStation 4

Sony joins Microsoft in charging for multiplayer gaming.


http://www.gamespot.com/news/sony-explains-why-ps-plus-is-required-for-ps4-online-play-6410806
Kotaku

PS4 Video Says PlayStation Plus Is Mandatory For Online Multiplayer

It's not all champagne and high fives coming out of Sony's E3 press conference today. A "screw you, Microsoft" video the PlayStation team put together has some fine print underneath, which reads:

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Honestly, they probably used that marketing. As stupid as it may seem, think of how many more people heard about the Xbox: One and their horrible idea. Just a thought.

I’m pretty sure PSN will still be free and Xbox live will still cost up to 9.99/mo. Sony is a much better company that cares for their consumers, I’ve gone through 3 of the ‘Original’ xbox 360s, and I had to pay to get 2 of them fixed, problems that weren’t even my fault. Microsoft produces cheap products to last a few years so they break and make people purchase the newer product.

Regardless, both systems will flourish.

item.title: Need to make this straight
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Xbox Wire

Your Feedback Matters – Update on Xbox One

Last week at E3, the excitement, creativity and future of our industry was on display for a global audience. For us, the future comes in the form of Xbox One, a system designed to be the best place to play games this year and for many years to come....

Trade-in, lend, resell, gift, and rent disc based games just like you do today – There will be no limitations to using and sharing games, it will work just as it does today on Xbox 360.
Based on that, sounds like Microsoft decided to cancel the used games fee, so that area of the list is wrong in regards to the Xbox One.

Read full topic
